title: torch.__future__ — PyTorch 2.9 documentation
text:
## torch.__future__#

Created On: Feb 05, 2024 | Last Updated On: Jun 12, 2025
Sets whether to assign new tensors to the parameters instead of changing the
existing parameters in-place when converting annn.Module.
nn.Module
When enabled, the following methods will assign new parameters to the module:
module.{device}()(e.g.nn.Module.cuda()) for moving a module between devices
module.{device}()
nn.Module.cuda()
module.{dtype}()(e.g.nn.Module.float()) for converting a module to a different dtype
module.{dtype}()
nn.Module.float()
nn.Module.to()
nn.Module.to()
nn.Module.to_empty()
nn.Module.to_empty()
value(bool) – Whether to assign new tensors or not.
Returns whether to assign new tensors to the parameters instead of changing the
existing parameters in-place when converting antorch.nn.Module. Defaults toFalse.
torch.nn.Module
False
Seeset_overwrite_module_params_on_conversion()for more information.
set_overwrite_module_params_on_conversion()
bool
Sets whether to useswap_tensors()instead of setting.datato
change the existing parameters in-place when converting annn.Moduleand instead
ofparam.copy_(state_dict[key])when loading a state dict into annn.Module.
swap_tensors()
.data
nn.Module
param.copy_(state_dict[key])
nn.Module
Note
This function takes precedence overget_overwrite_module_params_on_conversion()
get_overwrite_module_params_on_conversion()
When enabled, the following methods will swap the existing parameters in-place:
module.{device}()(e.g.nn.Module.cuda()) for moving a module between devices
module.{device}()
nn.Module.cuda()
module.{dtype}()(e.g.nn.Module.float()) for converting a module to a different dtype
module.{dtype}()
nn.Module.float()
nn.Module.to()
nn.Module.to()
nn.Module.to_empty()
nn.Module.to_empty()
nn.Module.load_state_dict()
nn.Module.load_state_dict()
The semantics forload_state_dict()when this is set are as follows:
load_state_dict()
For each parameter/buffer, its correspondingstate_dict['key']is transformed viamodule_load()(i.e.res=param.module_load(state_dict['key']))
state_dict['key']
module_load()
res=param.module_load(state_dict['key'])
If necessary,reswill be wrapped in anParameter
res
Parameter
The parameter/buffer in the module will be swapped viaswap_tensors()withres
swap_tensors()
res
value(bool) – Whether to useswap_tensors()or not.
swap_tensors()
Returns whether to useswap_tensors()instead of setting .data to
change the existing parameters in-place when converting annn.Module. Defaults toFalse.
swap_tensors()
nn.Module
False
Seeset_swap_module_params_on_conversion()for more information.
set_swap_module_params_on_conversion()
bool
